embedReply.title: Ù„ÛŒØ³Øª Ø¯Ø³ØªÙˆØ±Ø§Øª | Ù¾ÛŒØ´ÙˆÙ†Ø¯: {PREFIX}â€
embedReply.description:
[Add this bot to your server]({DISCORD_BOT_INVITE}) **|** [Website]({WEBSITE}) **|** [Documentation](https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter) **|** [GitHub](https://github.com/eduardozgz/member-counter-bot/)

Quick setup: `{PREFIX}setup`
Learn how to use the bot: `{PREFIX}guide`

To get more info about a command or counter send `{PREFIX}help` plus the name: ```
{PREFIX}help shortNumber``````
{PREFIX}help {members}```

**Ø¨Ø§Ø¨Øª Ø§ÙØ²ÙˆØ¯Ù† Member Counter Ø¨Ù‡ Ø³Ø±ÙˆØ±ØªØ§Ù† ØµÙ…ÛŒÙ…Ø§Ù†Ù‡ Ø³Ù¾Ø§Ø³Ú¯Ø°Ø§Ø±ÛŒÙ…!**

Ø¨Ø±Ø§ÛŒ Ø§ÛŒÙ† Ù…Ø«Ø§Ù„ Ù…Ø§ Ù…ÛŒØ§ÛŒÙ… Ø§Ø² `{members}` Ø§Ø³ØªÙØ§Ø¯Ù‡ Ú©Ù†ÛŒÙ… Ú©Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ø¹Ø« Ù…ÛŒ Ø´ÙˆØ¯ ØªØ¹Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ Ú©Ù„ Ø§Ø¹Ø¶Ø§Ø¡ Ø³Ø±ÙˆØ± Ø¯ÛŒØ³Ú©ÙˆØ±Ø¯ Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ø±Ø§ Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ Ù…ÛŒ Ú©Ù†Ø¯. Ø¨Ø§ Ø§ÛŒÙ†Ø­Ø§Ù„ Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ø®ÙˆØ¯ØªØ§Ù† Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†ÛŒØ¯ Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ù‡Ø§ÛŒ Ø¨ÛŒØ´ØªØ± Ø±Ø§ Ø¯Ø± ØµÙØ­Ø§Øª Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ù…Ø´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯Ù‡ Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯.
Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†ÛŒØ¯ Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ø±Ø§ Ø¯Ø± ÛŒÚ©ÛŒ Ø§Ø² Ù…Ú©Ø§Ù† Ù‡Ø§ÛŒ Ø²ÛŒØ± Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø± Ø¯Ù‡ÛŒØ¯:

- Ø¯Ø± **Ù†Ø§Ù…** ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ **ØµÙˆØªÛŒ**
- Ø¯Ø± **Ù†Ø§Ù…** ÛŒÚ© *Ø¯Ø³ØªÙ‡â€ŒØ¨Ù†Ø¯ÛŒ**
- Ø¯Ø±**ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª** ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ **Ù…ØªÙ†ÛŒ**
- Ø¯Ø± **ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª** ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ **Ø§Ø®Ø¨Ø§Ø±**

Ø­Ø§Ù„ ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ø¬Ø¯ÛŒØ¯ Ø¨Ø³Ø§Ø²ÛŒØ¯ Ùˆ Ø¨Ø§ ÙˆÛŒØ±Ø§ÛŒØ´ Ø¢Ù†ØŒ Ø¯Ø± Ù‚Ø³Ù…Øª Ù†Ø§Ù… ÛŒØ§ ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª Ø¢Ù† Ú†Ù†Ù„ `{members}` Ø±Ø§ Ø¨Ù†ÙˆÛŒØ³ÛŒØ¯ Ùˆ Ø³Ù¾Ø³ 'ØªØºÛŒÛŒØ±Ø§Øª Ø±Ø§ Ø°Ø®ÛŒØ±Ù‡' Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯

Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ù‡Ù…Ú†Ù†ÛŒÙ† Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†ÛŒØ¯ Ø§Ø² ØªØ±Ú©ÛŒØ¨ Ø¯Ù„Ø®ÙˆØ§Ù‡ Ú†Ù†Ø¯ Ù†ÙˆØ¹ Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ø¯Ø± Ù†Ø§Ù…/ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ØŒ Ø§Ø³ØªÙØ§Ø¯Ù‡ Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯. Ø§ÛŒÙ†Ù… ÛŒÚ© Ù†Ù…ÙˆÙ†Ù‡:
```
{onlineMembers}/{members} Ø§Ø¹Ø¶Ø§Ø¡ Ø¢Ù†Ù„Ø§ÛŒÙ†ØŒ {youtubeSubscribers:https://www.youtube.com/user/enyay} Ù…Ø´ØªØ±Ú©Ø§Ù† ÛŒÙˆØªÛŒÙˆØ¨!
{onlineMembersWithRole:614777997291028519,614816383053856769} Ø§Ø¯Ù…ÛŒÙ† Ùˆ Ù…Ø¯Ø±Ø§ØªÙˆØ± Ø¢Ù†Ù„Ø§ÛŒÙ† Ù‡Ø³ØªÙ†Ø¯!
```

> Ø§Ú¯Ø± Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ÛŒØª ØªØ¹Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ Ú©Ø§Ø±Ø§Ú©ØªØ± Ù‡Ù†Ú¯Ø§Ù… ÙˆÛŒØ±Ø§ÛŒØ´ Ù†Ø§Ù…/ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª ÛŒÚ© Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÛŒØ¯ÛŒØ¯ØŒ Ù„Ø·ÙØ§ `{PREFIX}help editChannel` Ø±Ø§ Ø§Ù…ØªØ­Ø§Ù† Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯
> Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†ÛŒØ¯ Ø¨Ø§ Ø§Ø³ØªÙØ§Ø¯Ù‡ Ø§Ø² `{PREFIX}seeSettings` Ù¾ÛŒÚ©Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø¯ÛŒ ÙØ¹Ù„ÛŒ ÛŒÚ© Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ø±Ø§ Ù…Ø´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯Ù‡ Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯. Ø§ÛŒÙ† Ù…ÙˆØ±Ø¯ Ø¨Ø±Ø§ÛŒ Ø§ÙØ²ÙˆØ¯Ù† Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ù‡Ø§ Ø¨Ø¯ÙˆÙ† ØºÛŒØ±ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„ Ú©Ø±Ø¯Ù† Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ù‡Ø§ÛŒ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ÛŒ Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†Ø¯ Ú©Ø§Ø±Ø¨Ø±Ø¯ÛŒ Ø¨Ø§Ø´Ø¯

__**Ø­Ø°Ù ÛŒÚ© Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡**__
Ø¨Ù‡ Ù‚Ø³Ù…Øª ÙˆÛŒØ±Ø§ÛŒØ´ Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ø±ÙØªÙ‡ Ùˆ {disable} Ø±Ø§ Ø¯Ø± Ù†Ø§Ù… ÛŒØ§ ØªÙˆØ¶ÛŒØ­Ø§Øª Ø¢Ù† Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ø¨Ù†ÙˆÛŒØ³ÛŒØ¯. Ù¾Ø³ Ø§Ø² Ø°Ø®ÛŒØ±Ù‡ ØªØºÛŒÛŒØ±Ø§ØªØŒ Member Counter Ø¢Ù† Ø±Ø§ Ø¨Ø§ ÛŒÚ© \âœ… Ø¬Ø§ÛŒÚ¯Ø°ÛŒÙ† Ø®ÙˆØ§Ù‡Ø¯ Ú©Ø±Ø¯ØŒ Ø¨Ø¯Ø§Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ù†ÛŒ Ú©Ù‡ Ø´Ù…Ø§ ØªÙ…Ø§Ù… Ø´Ù…Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ù‡Ø§ Ø±Ø§ Ø§Ø² Ø¢Ù† Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ø¨Ø§ Ù…ÙˆÙÙ‚ÛŒØª Ø­Ø°Ù Ù†Ù…ÙˆØ¯Ù‡â€ŒØ§ÛŒØ¯

guide.countersHeader:
__**Counters**__
> You should enable the developer mode in Discord (User Settings \> Appearance \> Advanced \> Developer Mode)
> To get an ID, right click in a channel/role and click "Copy ID"

> Those counters with a plus sign (\+) are premium counters, get more info in `{PREFIX}premium`

> If you wanna change the number formatting in a counter independently of the server settings, visit this [page](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/overwrite-settings), or do it manually by following this [instructions](https://github.com/eduardozgz/member-counter-bot/issues/98)
guide.footerText: Please read the first page of {PREFIX}guide to learn how to setup this counter

members.name: members
members.detailedDescription: Counts how many members has a server

approximatedOnlineMembers.name: approximatedOnlineMembers
approximatedOnlineMembers.description: Approximated online members in your server
approximatedOnlineMembers.detailedDescription: Counts approximately how many members are online in the server

onlineMembers.name: onlineMembers
onlineMembers.detailedDescription: Counts how many members are online in the server

offlineMembers.name: offlineMembers
offlineMembers.detailedDescription: Counts how many members are offline in the server

users.name: users
users.detailedDescription: Counts how many users (excluding bot accounts) are in the server

onlineUsers.name: onlineUsers
onlineUsers.description: Online users in your server (excludes bot)
onlineUsers.detailedDescription: Counts how many users (excluding bot accounts) are online in the server

offlineUsers.name: offlineUsers
offlineUsers.description: Offline users in your server (excludes bot)
offlineUsers.detailedDescription: Counts how many users (excluding bot accounts) are offline in the server

bots.name: bots
bots.description: Bots in your server (excludes normal users)
bots.detailedDescription: Counts how many bots (excluding normal accounts) are in the server

onlineBots.name: onlineBots
onlineBots.description: Online bots in your server (excludes normal users)
onlineBots.detailedDescription: Counts how many bots (excluding normal accounts) are online in the server

offlineBots.name: offlineBots
offlineBots.description: Offline bots in your server (excludes normal users)
offlineBots.detailedDescription: Counts how many bots (excluding normal accounts) are offline in the server

roles.name: roles
roles.detailedDescription: Counts how many roles are in the server

channels.name: channels
channels.description: Channels in your server (excludes categories) or under a category
channels.detailedDescription: Counts how many channels (excluding category channels) are in the server, if you specify one or more category IDs after the `:`, separated by commas, only the channels under those specified categories will be counted

membersWithRole.name: membersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
membersWithRole.description: Members with a role or roles
membersWithRole.detailedDescription: Counts how many members have a role or roles, write the roles IDs you wanna count after the `:`, and separate the IDs with commas

onlineMembersWithRole.name: onlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
onlineMembersWithRole.description: Online members with a role or roles
onlineMembersWithRole.detailedDescription: Counts how many members with a role or roles are online, write the roles IDs you wanna count after the `:`, and separate the IDs with commas

offlineMembersWithRole.name: offlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
offlineMembersWithRole.description: Offline members with a role or roles
offlineMembersWithRole.detailedDescription: Counts how many members with a role or roles are offline, write the roles IDs you wanna count after the `:`, and separate the IDs with commas

connectedMembers.name: connectedMembers:channel1ID,channel2ID
connectedMembers.detailedDescription: Counts how many members are connected to all the voice channels or to the specified ones, write the channel IDs you wanna filter after the `:`, and separate the IDs with commas

bannedMembers.name: bannedMembers
bannedMembers.description: Amount of banned members in your server
bannedMembers.detailedDescription: Counts how many members are banned, the bot must have ban permissions to get this count
example: {bannedMembers} have been hit with the ban hammer

membersPlaying.name: membersPlaying:game name
membersPlaying.description: Amount of members playing a game
membersPlaying.detailedDescription: Counts how many members are playing a game, you can add multiple games by separating them with a comma
example: {membersPlaying: euro truck simulator 2, american truck simulator} Trucking

nitro-boosters.name: nitro-boosters
nitro-boosters.description: Counts the total amount of members boosting this server
nitro-boosters.detailedDescription: Counts the total amount of members boosting this server

youtubeSubscribers.name: youtubeSubscribers:channelUrl
youtubeSubscribers.description: Amount of subscribers of a YouTube channel
youtubeSubscribers.detailedDescription: Counts how many subscribers has a YouTube channel, replace `channelUrl` with the desired channel url

youtubeViews.name: youtubeViews:channelUrl
youtubeViews.description: Amount of views of a YouTube channel
youtubeViews.detailedDescription: Counts how many views has a YouTube channel, replace `channelUrl` with the desired channel url

youtubeVideos.name: youtubeVideos:channelUrl
youtubeVideos.description: Amount of videos of a YouTube channel
youtubeVideos.detailedDescription: Counts how many videos has a YouTube channel, replace `channelUrl` with the desired channel url

youtubeChannelName.name: youtubeChannelName:channelUrl
youtubeChannelName.description: Displays the name of a YouTube channel
youtubeChannelName.detailedDescription: Displays the name of a YouTube channel, replace `channelUrl` with the desired channel url

twitchFollowers.name: twitchFollowers:nickname
twitchFollowers.description: Amount of followers of a Twitch channel
twitchFollowers.detailedDescription: Counts how many followers has a Twitch channel, replace `nickname` with the desired channel name

twitchViews.name: twitchViews:nickname
twitchViews.description: Amount of views of a Twitch channel
twitchViews.detailedDescription: Counts how many views has a Twitch channel, replace `nickname` with the desired channel name

twitchChannelName.name: twitchChannelName:nickname
twitchChannelName.description: Displays the name of a Twitch channel
twitchChannelName.detailedDescription: Displays the name of a Twitch channel, replace `nickname` with the desired channel name

memeratorMemes.name: memeratorMemes:username
memeratorMemes.detailedDescription: Displays a [Memerator](https://memerator.me) user's meme count, replace `username` with the desired profile name

memeratorFollowers.name: memeratorFollowers:username
memeratorFollowers.detailedDescription: Displays a [Memerator](https://memerator.me) user's follower count, replace `username` with the desired profile name

twitterFollowers.name: twitterFollowers:username
twitterFollowers.description: Amount of followers of a Twitter user
twitterFollowers.detailedDescription: Counts how many followers has a Twitter user, replace `username` with the desired profile name

redditMembers.name: redditMembers:subreddit
redditMembers.description: Counts the amount of members of a subreddit
redditMembers.detailedDescription: Counts the amount of members of a subreddit, replace `subreddit` with the desired subreddit

redditMembersOnline.name: redditMembersOnline:subreddit
redditMembersOnline.description: Counts the amount of online members of a subreddit
redditMembersOnline.detailedDescription: Counts the amount of members of a subreddit, replace `subreddit` with the desired subreddit

redditTitle.name: redditTitle:subreddit
redditTitle.description: Displays the title of a subreddit
redditTitle.detailedDescription: Displays the title of a subreddit, replace `subreddit` with the desired subreddit

instagramFollowers.name: instagramFollowers:username
instagramFollowers.description: Counts the amount of followers in an Instagram account
instagramFollowers.detailedDescription: Counts the amount of followers in an Instagram account, replace `username` with the actual Instagram username

countdown.name: countdown:targetDate:format
countdown.description: Shows a countdown that will decrease to the specified target date
countdown.detailedDescription: Shows a countdown that will decrease to the specified target date, you can easily [generate this counter here](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/countdown) or manually creating it by replacing `targetDate` with the target date in a UNIX timestamp, and optionally `format` it with a custom format: use `%d` to show the days left, `%h` to show the hours left, `%m` to show the minutes left and `%s` to show the seconds left

game.name: game:gameId:address
game.description: Online players in a game server (Minecraft, Counter Strike, Rust, Ark, Team Fortress 2, GMOD, etc)
game.detailedDescription: Counts how many online players are in a game server (like Minecraft, Counter Strike, Rust, Ark, Team Fortress 2, GMOD, etc), replace `gameId` by one of the listed [here](https://github.com/gamedig/node-gamedig/#games-list) and `address` by the actual server address

clock.name: clock:timeZone
clock.description: Shows a clock with the time of the specified timezone
clock.detailedDescription: Shows a clock with the time of the specified timezone, you can easily [generate this counter here](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/clock) or replace `timeZone` with a valid IANA timezone

http.name: http:options
http.description: Shows the result of a http request
http.detailedDescription: Shows the result returned by a http `GET` request. You can setup the `options` [here](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/http), or create it manually: `options` is a JSON object encoded in base64 (you can use {PREFIX}base64 command to achieve this), this object can have the following keys: `url`: A string; with the url of the resource, `parseNumber`: A boolean; if the result is a valid number, it will be parsed and customized according to your server's settings, `dataPath`: A string; if the response is a JSON object, you must specify the path to a key with a value that must be a string or number, the syntax of this path is similar to the syntax that JS uses to access properties and array items, `lifetime`: A number; specifies in seconds for how long the returned response will be cached and used, the default is 1 hour

replace.name: replace:text:oldValue;newValue
replace.description: Replaces portions of the given text with the given values
replace.detailedDescription:
Replaces portions of the given text with the given values, this counter is useful alongside the `{http}` counter to for example, read data from an API, and depending on the returned response, translate the response to something more human friendly.
`text` should be the original text or a counter like `{http}`, `oldValue` the value to search and `newValue` the value that will replace `oldValue`, you can replace multiple values by separating them with a comma as shown below in the examples.

escape.name: escape:stringToEscape
escape.description: Escapes common delimiters used by Member Counter
escape.detailedDescription: Escapes automatically all the delimiters used by Member Counter when processing a counter. Like `:`,`;` or `,`. You may need this if you want to pass arguments with the mentioned delimiters without getting them parsed. This is specially useful when you can't control well the content of the string like in the `{http}` counter

static.name: static:data
static.detailedDescription: Displays the given `data` with custom formatting based on the server settings if it's a number, text is also accepted

sum.name: sum:value1,value2,more values
sum.detailedDescription: Sum of the specified values, done from the left to the right

subtract.name: subtract:value1,value2,more values
subtract.detailedDescription: Subtracts the specified values, done from the left to the right

multiply.name: multiply:value1,value2,more values
multiply.detailedDescription: Multiplies the specified values, done from the left to the right

divide.name: divide:value1,value2,more values
divide.detailedDescription: Divides the specified values, done from the left to the right

modulus.name: modulus:value1,value2,more values
modulus.description: Gets the modulus of the specified values
modulus.detailedDescription: Gets the modulus of the specified values, done from the left to the right

lockChannel.helpDescription: Ø´Ù…Ø§ Ù…ÛŒ ØªÙˆØ§Ù†ÛŒØ¯ Ø§Ø² Ø§ÛŒÙ† Ø¯Ø³ØªÙˆØ± Ø¨Ø±Ø§ÛŒ Ù†Ù…Ø§ÛŒØ´ Ø´Ú©Ù„ Ù‚ÙÙ„ (ğŸ”’) Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¬Ø§ÛŒ Ù†Ù…Ø§ÛŒØ´ Ø´Ú©Ù„ Ø¨Ù„Ù†Ø¯Ú¯Ùˆ (ğŸ”Š) Ø¯Ø± Ú†Ù†Ù„ Ù‡Ø§ÛŒ ØµÙˆØªÛŒØŒ Ø§Ø³ØªÙØ§Ø¯Ù‡ Ú©Ù†ÛŒØ¯.

setDigit.helpDescription:
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument can be anything, like an emoji or a normal number, you can customize multiple numbers at once by separating the arguments with commas (`,`)
If the first argument is the word "reset", the numbers will be restored to the default ones.
setDigit.resetSuccess: Numbers restored to the default ones.

shortNumber.helpDescription: This command allows you to show a count in a compact form in counters.

locale.helpDescription: Formats the numbers and clocks (12h/24h format) to the specified locale.

role.helpDescription:
You can allow or deny roles to use bot administrative commands.
You can use ``all`` keyword to allow or deny all roles.
To see which roles are currently allowed use `{PREFIX}seeSettings`.

profile.removeDataConfirmation:
Please send exactly this text if you want to delete all your data: ```{CONFIRMATION_STRING}```
:warning: **This action will remove all your data, your badges, server upgrades and credits will be lost forever, invoices will be kept for legal reasons, are you sure you want to continue? (Ignore or type '{CANCEL_STRING}' to cancel)**
profile.removeDataConfirmationString: I want to delete all of my data
profile.removeDataSuccess: Your data has been removed successfully
profile.userNotFound: User not found in the DB

setup.helpDescription:
Creates some locked voice channels with some counters in them
Optionally set up YouTube or Twitch channel counters.

base64.helpDescription: A base64 utility command, useful to customize specific counters or create advanced counters like `{http}`.
base64.invalidAction: Invalid action, it must be `encode` or `decode`

checkPermissions.helpDescription: Ø¨Ø±Ø±Ø³ÛŒ Ù…ÛŒ Ú©Ù†Ø¯ Ú©Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Øª Ø¢ÛŒØ§ Ø¯Ø³ØªØ±Ø³ÛŒ Ù‡Ø§ÛŒ Ù…ÙˆØ±Ø¯ Ù†ÛŒØ§Ø² Ø±Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¯Ø±Ø³ØªÛŒ Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ø¯ ØªØ§ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø®ÙˆØ¨ÛŒ Ú©Ø§Ø± Ú©Ù†Ø¯ ÛŒØ§ Ù†Ù‡.
checkPermissions.title: Check permissions
checkPermissions.adminWarning: **This bot has administrator permission, please toggle off the administrator permission and setup the right permissions**
checkPermissions.footer: If you need to fix permissions problems, try inviting the bot again:

manageChannels.name: Manage channels
manageChannels.description: Used to update the name/description of the channels to update the counters

viewChannel.name: View channels
viewChannel.description: Used to update the name/description of the channels to update the counters, also used to receive commands

voiceConnect.name: Connect
voiceConnect.description: Used to update the name/description of the channels to update the counters

readMessageHistory.name: Read message history
readMessageHistory.description: Used to update counters in messages/embeds

addReactions.name: Add reactions
addReactions.description: Used to add reactions in commands to interact with it

manageMessages.name: Manage messages
manageMessages.description: Used to remove reactions in a command

manageRoles.name: Manage roles
manageRoles.description: Used by the {PREFIX}setup command and to update channel permissions when you add a Premium bot

banMembers.name: Ban members
banMembers.description: Used to display the amount of banned members in the `{bannedMembers}` counter

commandHandler.noDm: You can't run this command on a DM channel

getCounts.noBanPerms: I need ban permissions to show this
